triageFlags.title: Loan-to-Value exceeds policy limit
triageFlags.description: The Loan-to-Value ratio exceeds the maximum allowed for the applicant's credit tier.
triageFlags.recommendation: Consider reducing the loan amount or increasing the deposit to meet the LTV policy requirements.
triageFlags.reasoning: According to the policy, the maximum LTV for Tier A applicants is 110%. The calculated LTV for this proposal is 102.5%, which is within the acceptable range for Tier A.

triageFlags.title: Debt-to-Income Ratio Exceeds Policy Limit
triageFlags.description: The applicant's Debt-to-Income ratio exceeds the maximum allowed for their credit tier.
triageFlags.recommendation: Consider reducing the loan amount or increasing the deposit to lower the DTI ratio.
triageFlags.reasoning: The policy specifies a maximum DTI of 40% for Tier B applicants. The calculated DTI for this proposal is 42.5%, which exceeds the allowable limit.

content.reasoning: The analysis of the proposal revealed two medium-severity issues: the Loan-to-Value (LTV) ratio exceeds the policy limit for the applicant's credit tier, and the Debt-to-Income (DTI) ratio is above the maximum allowed for the same tier. These findings suggest that the financial structure of the loan may pose a moderate risk.
